bonuses.leadin: Like Todd Akin, this Republican politician lost a Senate election in 2012 after making insensitive comments about rape. For 10 points each:
bonuses.formatted_leadin: Like Todd Akin, this Republican politician lost a Senate election in 2012 after making insensitive comments about rape. For 10 points each:
texts: Name this former Indiana state treasurer who defeated incumbent Dick Lugar (“LOO-gar”) in the 2012 senatorial primary before losing to Democratic candidate Joe Donnelly.

In his 2010 campaign for treasurer, Mourdock defeated this Democrat, the son of a Marxist academic. This former management consultant at McKinsey was subsequently elected mayor of South Bend, Indiana.
As a consultant for McKinsey, Buttigieg worked with this Canadian supermarket chain, which in 2018 was discovered to have been illegally fixing the price of bread.
answers: Loblaws [or Loblaw Companies Limited] <CK, Modern World>
formatted_texts: Name this former Indiana state treasurer who defeated incumbent Dick Lugar (“LOO-gar”) in the 2012 senatorial primary before losing to Democratic candidate Joe Donnelly.

In his 2010 campaign for treasurer, Mourdock defeated this Democrat, the son of a Marxist academic. This former management consultant at McKinsey was subsequently elected mayor of South Bend, Indiana.
As a consultant for McKinsey, Buttigieg worked with this Canadian supermarket chain, which in 2018 was discovered to have been illegally fixing the price of bread.

bonuses.leadin: This businessman deducted a day of pay from of his employees to fund the re-election campaign of California governor Frank Merriam, and had his longtime collaborator Irving Thalberg produce a series of fake newsreels attacking Merriam’s opponent, Upton Sinclair. For 10 points each:
bonuses.formatted_leadin: This businessman deducted a day of pay from of his employees to fund the re-election campaign of California governor Frank Merriam, and had his longtime collaborator Irving Thalberg produce a series of fake newsreels attacking Merriam’s opponent, Upton Sinclair. For 10 points each:
texts: Name this movie executive who ran a studio based out of Culver City for much of the early twentieth century.

Mayer’s fellow Republican Hollywood mogul, Jack Warner, was responsible for naming many of the members of the “Hollywood Ten” as members of the Communist Party in 1947 to this Congressional committee that investigated alleged cases of political disloyalty.

The conservative Motion Picture Alliance for the Preservation of American Ideals released this author’s 1947 Screen Guide for Americans, which warned against the glorification of the “common man” on screen. This author, whose first published book was on the actress Pola Negri, also wrote the screenplay for a 1949 King Vidor film
formatted_texts: Name this movie executive who ran a studio based out of Culver City for much of the early twentieth century.

Mayer’s fellow Republican Hollywood mogul, Jack Warner, was responsible for naming many of the members of the “Hollywood Ten” as members of the Communist Party in 1947 to this Congressional committee that investigated alleged cases of political disloyalty.

The conservative Motion Picture Alliance for the Preservation of American Ideals released this author’s 1947 Screen Guide for Americans, which warned against the glorification of the “common man” on screen. This author, whose first published book was on the actress Pola Negri, also wrote the screenplay for a 1949 King Vidor film

bonuses.leadin: This woman traveled with her daughter Lily across the isthmus of Panama to settle in San Francisco during the Gold Rush. For 10 points each:
bonuses.formatted_leadin: This woman traveled with her daughter Lily across the isthmus of Panama to settle in San Francisco during the Gold Rush. For 10 points each:
texts: Name this woman who petitioned Abraham Lincoln for reinforcements for a department her husband commanded in St. Louis. She helped her husband gain fame by ghostwriting accounts of his expeditions.
The slogan “Fremont and Jessie Too” was used when John C. Fremont ran for president during this election year, making him the first presidential nominee from the Republican Party.

Jessie Fremont wrote A Year of American Travel while John C. Fremont was governor of this territory. Fremont’s former guide Kit Carson forced Native Americans to leave this territory in the Long Walk to Bosque Redondo.
answers: Jessie Benton Fremont [or Jessie Benton; or Jessie Ann Benton Fremont; prompt on Fremont]

bonuses.leadin: 5 years after this brouhaha, its central actor started writing novels like A Parliamentary Affair and The Ambassador. For 10 points each:
bonuses.formatted_leadin: 5 years after this brouhaha, its central actor started writing novels like A Parliamentary Affair and The Ambassador. For 10 points each:
texts: Name or describe this controversy, which resulted in a 60% drop of a certain food item. It led to the resignation of the Junior Health Minister Edwina Currie.

Edwina Currie poured a glass of orange juice over Peter Snape in this election year, the last win for the Conservatives before 2015. Queen Elizabeth II called this year an annus horribilis for the Royal Family.

Edwina Currie’s diaries are better-known for candid descriptions of her affair with this politician, who launched the “Back to Basics” campaign to promote “neighbourliness, decency, and courtesy.” He succeeded Thatcher as PM.
answers: salmonella in eggs controversy [accept equivalents mentioning Edwina Currie's claim that most of the eggs in the U.K. are infected with salmonella]

Edwina Currie poured a glass of orange juice over Peter Snape in this election year, the last win for the Conservatives before 2015. Queen Elizabeth II called this year an annus horribilis for the Royal Family.

Edwina Currie’s diaries are better-known for candid descriptions of her affair with this politician, who launched the “Back to Basics” campaign to promote “neighbourliness, decency, and courtesy.” He succeeded Thatcher as PM.
formatted_answers: salmonella in eggs controversy [accept equivalents mentioning Edwina Currie's claim that most of the eggs in the U.K. are infected with salmonella]

texts: Identify this four-word campaign slogan, a play on a sitting president’s demeanor. It helped its proponent win an election in which the opposing party had a notorious convention called the “Klanbake.”
Calvin Coolidge succeeded this scandal-plagued President who died in office in 1923.
The negotiation of this 1928 international agreement named for an American and a Frenchman, whose parties promised to renounce war, was a major foreign policy goal of the Coolidge Administration.

texts: Name this American conservative commentator who hosted the television show Firing Line and founded the National Review.
This president appointed Buckley as a delegate to the United Nations. He was president during the Apollo 11 landings and the establishment of the EPA.
In 1965, Buckley lost the New York mayoral election to this man, who is sometimes credited with preventing a 1968 riot by talking down a gathered crowd after the Martin Luther King assassination.
formatted_texts: Name this American conservative commentator who hosted the television show Firing Line and founded the National Review.
This president appointed Buckley as a delegate to the United Nations. He was president during the Apollo 11 landings and the establishment of the EPA.
In 1965, Buckley lost the New York mayoral election to this man, who is sometimes credited with preventing a 1968 riot by talking down a gathered crowd after the Martin Luther King assassination.

bonuses.leadin: An expansion to the Sussex County courthouse turned up the skull of this woman, who cemented her status in American folklore with the 1841 publication of the "Female Fiend" pamphlet. For 10 points each:
bonuses.formatted_leadin: An expansion to the Sussex County courthouse turned up the skull of this woman, who cemented her status in American folklore with the 1841 publication of the "Female Fiend" pamphlet. For 10 points each:
texts: Name this woman who ran a "reverse underground railroad" by kidnapping free blacks and selling them back into slavery. She skirted the law by walking between different states from her house to her barn.

As a karmic counterweight to housing Patty Cannon's barn, this state was where Peter Spencer founded the AUMP Church, the first independent black denomination in America. It received one of its nicknames from the game fowl that amused its Revolutionary War militia.

Cannon's gang took advantage of the spike in slave prices in this year, in which the twenty-year Constitutional protection of the slave trade ended. Charles Cotesworth Pinckney lost the election of this year to James Madison.
formatted_texts: Name this woman who ran a "reverse underground railroad" by kidnapping free blacks and selling them back into slavery. She skirted the law by walking between different states from her house to her barn.

As a karmic counterweight to housing Patty Cannon's barn, this state was where Peter Spencer founded the AUMP Church, the first independent black denomination in America. It received one of its nicknames from the game fowl that amused its Revolutionary War militia.

Cannon's gang took advantage of the spike in slave prices in this year, in which the twenty-year Constitutional protection of the slave trade ended. Charles Cotesworth Pinckney lost the election of this year to James Madison.

bonuses.formatted_leadin: Tammany Hall first came to prominence after successfully electing this candidate in New York's 1854 mayoral election. For 10 points each:
texts: Name this Democratic mayor of New York who served from 1854 to 1857 and again from 1860 to 1863. His mayoral terms were sandwiched between terms in the U.S. House of Representatives.

Fernando Wood and other Tammany Hall members were supported by this gang of New York immigrants, who often clashed with the Bowery Boys and Atlantic Guards. Hell-Cat Maggie was a member of this gang, which names an 1857 riot.
Fernando Wood left the mayor's office just before violent 1863 New York riots over this wartime practice.
answers: Civil War draft [accept equivalents like conscription]

Fernando Wood left the mayor's office just before violent 1863 New York riots over this wartime practice.

bonuses.leadin: This man served as the president of the Union Pacific from 1863 to 1868. For 10 points each:
bonuses.formatted_leadin: This man served as the president of the Union Pacific from 1863 to 1868. For 10 points each:
texts: Name this New York governor who, at the beginning of the Civil War, arrested the Maryland legislature. He was appointed Secretary of the Treasury late in Buchanan term.
John Adams Dix was succeeded as Governor of New York by this man. This Bourbon Democrat lost the election of 1876 to Rutherford B. Hayes.
Both Tilden and Dix had at one point aided this faction of the New York Democratic Party. Opposed to slavery, this group was led by Martin van Buren.
answers: Barnburners [prompt on Free Soil Party; prompt on Free Soilers]

bonuses.leadin: Answer the following about the hard life of Andrew Johnson, FTPE
bonuses.formatted_leadin: Answer the following about the hard life of Andrew Johnson, FTPE
texts: The oath of office was administered to a drunken Johnson by this Chief Justice, who'd resigned as Secretary of the Treasury in 1864.

Bill Seward joined Andrew Johnson on this disastrous speaking campaign where the president tried to drum up support for the midterm elections in 1866. Named for its general route, Garry Boulard described this campaign as "The Train Ride That Destroyed a Presidency".

During the Swing Around the Circle, Johnson accused Radical Republicans of orchestrating a riot in this city.  A contested 1872 election led to the Battle of Liberty Place in this city, where a group known as the White League stormed the state militia.
answers: The Swing Around the Circle Campaign [prompt on "Andy's Trip"]
formatted_texts: The oath of office was administered to a drunken Johnson by this Chief Justice, who'd resigned as Secretary of the Treasury in 1864.

Bill Seward joined Andrew Johnson on this disastrous speaking campaign where the president tried to drum up support for the midterm elections in 1866. Named for its general route, Garry Boulard described this campaign as "The Train Ride That Destroyed a Presidency".

During the Swing Around the Circle, Johnson accused Radical Republicans of orchestrating a riot in this city.  A contested 1872 election led to the Battle of Liberty Place in this city, where a group known as the White League stormed the state militia.
formatted_answers: The Swing Around the Circle Campaign [prompt on "Andy's Trip"]

bonuses.leadin: Answer the following about the best presidential election to be held in 1848, the election of 1848, for 10 points each:
bonuses.formatted_leadin: Answer the following about the best presidential election to be held in 1848, the election of 1848, for 10 points each:
texts: While Zachary Taylor defeated Lewis Cass, the Free Soil party nominated this former president as a third party candidate. This man used to be a big wheel in the Albany Regency.

This Ohio Congressman fell one vote short of capturing the Free Soil nomination. During the Creole case of 1841, he was censured and later resigned after he introduced resolutions saying the slaves who participated in a ship wide revolt had violated no law. He later became a founder of the Republican Party.

This Delaware politician received very little support at the Whig convention but became Zachary Taylor's Secretary of State. His brief tenure's most important foreign policy achievement attempted to settle a dispute with England over who possessed the Mosquito Coast.

He later became a founder of the Republican Party.

This Delaware politician received very little support at the Whig convention but became Zachary Taylor's Secretary of State. His brief tenure's most important foreign policy achievement attempted to settle a dispute with England over who possessed the Mosquito Coast.

bonuses.leadin: This state's governor, La Fayette Grover, was implicated but eventually exonerated on vote-rigging charges. For 10 points each:
bonuses.formatted_leadin: This state's governor, La Fayette Grover, was implicated but eventually exonerated on vote-rigging charges. For 10 points each:
texts: Name this state which was one of the focal states in the election which ultimately elected Rutherford B. Hayes, as all three of its electoral votes were awarded to Hayes despite Grover's attempts at supporting Hayes' rival.
Thanks to the Electoral Commission, Hayes defeated this Democratic opponent, a former reform-minded Governor of New York noted for taking on such crooks as Boss Tweed and the Canal Ring.

The Commission ended up having more Republicans than Democrats because this Supreme Court justice, an independent, left the Commission to take a Senate seat. As a justice, his best known opinion was Ex Parte Milligan.

bonuses.formatted_leadin: This man pressured Bayard Rustin into resigning from the SCLC. For 10 points each:
texts: Name this man who was a longtime Congressman representing Harlem. Due to accusations of impropriety, he was eventually stripped of his committee chairmanships and excluded by the House in 1967.

Powell was succeeded as Harlem's Congressman by this controversial Democrat. In November 2010, he was found guilty by the House's Ethics Committee for engaging in such improper acts as renting apartments below-market rates and not reporting his full income.

Rangel was a member of the "Gang of Four" political coalition, which included Basil Paterson, Percy Sutton, and this man, who lost a mayoral election partly after fallout related to the racially motivated Crown Heights riot.
